greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Start with 3,2 and apply the rule a(a(1)+a(2)+...+a(n)) = a(n), fill in any undefined terms with a(t) = 2 if a(t-1) = 3 and a(t) = 3 if a(t-1) = 2.
comment: More generally, sequence a(n) = floor(r*(n+2))-floor(r*(n+1)), r = (1/2) *(z+sqrt(z^2+4)), z integer >=1, is defined with a(1), a(2) and a(a(1)+a(2)+...+a(n)+f(z)) = a(n); a(a(1)+a(2)+...+a(n)+f(z)+1) = (2z+1)-a(n) where f(1)=0, f(z)=z-2 for z>=2.
Conjecture: a(n) = A097509(n+1). - _Benedict W. J. Irwin_, Mar 13 2016. [See the discussion in A097509. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 09 2021]
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Families of Essentially Identical Sequences, Mar 24 2021 (Includes this sequence)
xref: The following sequences are all essentially the same, in the sense that they are simple transformations of each other, with A003151 as the parent: A003151, A001951, A001952, A003152, A006337, A080763, A082844 (conjectured), A097509, A159684, A188037, A245219 (conjectured), A276862. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 09 2021
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 15 2003; revised Jun 07 2003
